Title:
A phylogenetic supertree of the hammerhead sharks
(Carcharhiniformes, Sphyrnidae)
Abstract:
In this study, five hammerhead shark phylogenies (based on
morphological, isozyme, and mtDNA sequence data) were combined to
generate a complete, well-resolved composite phylogeny for the
Sphyrnidae using matrix representation with parsimony. The resulting
supertree contains all the 8 known sphynid species and represents the
best estimate of combined relationships presented in the original five
source trees. The supertree will provide a useful framework for
phylogenetic comparative studies of sphyrnid evolution, ecology, and
biogeography.
